author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
content: A young boy discovers he's a wizard and attends a magical school called Hogwarts, where he uncovers the truth about his past and a dark wizard's return.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Fellowship of the Ring
content: A hobbit named Frodo embarks on a perilous journey to destroy an ancient ring that holds immense power, accompanied by a diverse fellowship.

author: George R.R. Martin
title: A Game of Thrones
content: Noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne as ancient threats stir in the North and across the sea, where dragons may rise again.

author: Harper Lee
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
content: In the racially divided American South, a young girl learns about justice and empathy as her father defends a black man accused of a crime he didn’t commit.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
content: A mysterious millionaire throws extravagant parties in hopes of rekindling a lost love, revealing the hollowness of the American Dream.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
content: Elizabeth Bennet navigates issues of manners, marriage, and social status while falling for the proud but honorable Mr. Darcy.

author: Mary Shelley
title: Frankenstein
content: A young scientist creates a living being from dead parts, only to abandon his creation and face tragic consequences.

author: Ray Bradbury
title: Fahrenheit 451
content: In a future society where books are banned, a fireman tasked with burning them begins to question his role and seeks enlightenment.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Brave New World
content: A dystopian future of engineered humans, consumerism, and a society controlled by pleasure and conditioning.

author: George Orwell
content: In a totalitarian state ruled by Big Brother, one man dares to defy oppression and seek the truth.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: The Old Man and the Sea
content: An aging fisherman battles a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream, testing his strength and spirit.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Anna Karenina
content: A tale of love, betrayal, and societal expectations set against the backdrop of Imperial Russia.

author: Markus Zusak
title: The Book Thief
content: During WWII, a young girl finds solace in stealing books and sharing them, even as Death itself narrates her story.

author: Mark Twain
title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
content: A boy and a runaway slave travel down the Mississippi River, discovering the complexities of freedom and morality.

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: Jane Eyre
content: An orphaned girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her mysterious employer, uncovering dark secrets.

author: Herman Melville
title: Moby-Dick
content: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts a great white whale, leading to a tale of revenge and madness at sea.

author: J.D. Salinger
title: The Catcher in the Rye
content: A disaffected teenager wanders New York City, struggling with alienation and the phoniness of adulthood.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
content: The rise and fall of the Buendía family in the magical town of Macondo reflects the history of Latin America.

author: Paulo Coelho
title: The Alchemist
content: A young shepherd sets out on a journey to discover his personal legend and the meaning of life.

author: Douglas Adams
title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
content: After Earth is destroyed, Arthur Dent journeys through space with odd companions and absurd adventures.
